description: Verify that the Privacy Policy page loads correctly when accessing the /privacy-policy URL
scenario: User navigates to the Privacy Policy page to read about data protection and privacy rights
expected_results: Display the complete Privacy Policy page with header, content sections, and proper RA 10173 compliance information
procedure:
1. Open web browser
2. Navigate to http://localhost:5000/privacy-policy
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check page title displays 'Privacy Policy'
5. Verify all policy sections are visible and properly formatted

description: Verify the privacy policy header displays correctly with dates and shield icon
scenario: User views the Privacy Policy header with gradient background and policy information
expected_results: Display 'Privacy Policy' title, shield icon, subtitle about RA 10173, and last updated/effective dates
procedure:
1. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
2. Verify header title 'Privacy Policy' is visible
3. Check shield lock icon is displayed
4. Verify subtitle mentions 'RA 10173' compliance
5. Check 'Last Updated' date shows May 29, 2025
6. Verify 'Effective Date' shows June 12, 2025 (14 days after)
7. Verify gradient background is applied properly

description: Verify the policy dates are calculated correctly using the get_policy_dates() helper function
scenario: System generates consistent policy dates across all policy pages
expected_results: Date updated shows May 29, 2025 and effective date shows June 12, 2025 (14 days later)
procedure:
1. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
2. Check displayed 'Last Updated' date
3. Verify it shows 'May 29, 2025'
4. Check displayed 'Effective Date'
5. Verify it shows 'June 12, 2025'
6. Confirm 14-day difference between dates
7. Test date formatting is consistent
8. Verify dates match main.py get_policy_dates() function

description: Verify all sections required by Republic Act 10173 (Data Privacy Act) are present
scenario: User reads privacy policy to understand their rights under Philippine data protection law
expected_results: Display all required sections including data controller info, legal basis, data subject rights, and security measures
procedure:
1. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
2. Verify 'Introduction and Legal Framework' section mentions RA 10173
3. Check 'Data Controller Information' section is present
4. Verify 'Definitions (Per RA 10173)' section exists
5. Check 'Legal Basis for Processing (Section 12)' is displayed
6. Verify 'Data Privacy Principles (Section 11)' section
7. Check 'Your Rights as a Data Subject (Section 16)' section
8. Verify 'Security of Personal Information (Section 20)' section
9. Check 'National Privacy Commission' contact information

description: Verify the data subject rights section displays all rights under Section 16 of RA 10173
scenario: User wants to understand their privacy rights under Philippine law
expected_results: Display six rights cards: Right to be Informed, Right of Access, Right to Rectification, Right to Erasure/Blocking, Right to Data Portability, and Right to Indemnification
procedure:
1. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
2. Scroll to 'Your Rights as a Data Subject' section
3. Verify 'Right to be Informed' card is displayed
4. Check 'Right of Access' card exists
5. Verify 'Right to Rectification' card is present
6. Check 'Right to Erasure/Blocking' card is shown
7. Verify 'Right to Data Portability (Section 18)' card
8. Check 'Right to Indemnification' card is displayed
9. Verify each card has appropriate color coding
10. Check hover effects work on rights cards

description: Verify the legal basis section displays four lawful grounds under Section 12 of RA 10173
scenario: User wants to understand why their data is being processed
expected_results: Display four colored cards: Consent, Contract Performance, Legitimate Interest, and Legal Obligation
procedure:
1. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
2. Scroll to 'Legal Basis for Processing' section
3. Verify 'Consent (Section 12(a))' green card is displayed
4. Check 'Contract Performance (Section 12(b))' blue card exists
5. Verify 'Legitimate Interest (Section 12(f))' purple card is present
6. Check 'Legal Obligation (Section 12(c))' orange card is shown
7. Verify each card contains appropriate descriptions
8. Check grid layout displays properly
9. Test responsive behavior of cards

description: Verify the security measures section displays technical and organizational measures
scenario: User wants to understand how their data is protected
expected_results: Display two cards showing Technical Measures and Organizational Measures for data protection
procedure:
1. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
2. Scroll to 'Security of Personal Information' section
3. Verify section references 'Section 20 of RA 10173'
4. Check 'Technical Measures' blue card is displayed
5. Verify 'Organizational Measures' green card is present
6. Check both cards contain security measure descriptions
7. Verify proper color coding and layout
8. Test card hover effects and responsiveness

description: Verify contact information for the National Privacy Commission is displayed correctly
scenario: User needs to know how to file a complaint with the privacy regulator
expected_results: Display complete NPC contact information including address, email, and website
procedure:
1. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
2. Scroll to 'National Privacy Commission' section
3. Verify 'Filing Complaints' subsection is present
4. Check NPC address shows 'Philippine International Convention Center'
5. Verify email shows 'info@privacy.gov.ph'
6. Check website shows 'https://www.privacy.gov.ph'
7. Verify address includes 'Vicente Sotto St., Pasay City'
8. Check blue information box styling
9. Test email link functionality

description: Verify the definitions section displays key terms from RA 10173
scenario: User wants to understand privacy terminology used in the policy
expected_results: Display three definition cards: Personal Information, Sensitive Personal Information, and Processing
procedure:
1. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
2. Scroll to 'Definitions (Per RA 10173)' section
3. Verify 'Personal Information' definition with blue border is displayed
4. Check 'Sensitive Personal Information' definition with orange border
5. Verify 'Processing' definition with green border is present
6. Check each definition contains accurate legal text
7. Verify border color coding is consistent
8. Test definition card layout and spacing

description: Verify the privacy policy route works correctly in main.py blueprint
scenario: User accesses privacy policy through direct URL and navigation links
expected_results: Route renders privacy-policy.html template with correct date parameters
procedure:
1. Navigate directly to /privacy-policy URL
2. Verify route loads correctly from main_bp blueprint
3. Check template renders privacy-policy.html file
4. Verify date_updated and date_effective parameters are passed
5. Test route works from navigation menu links
6. Check browser URL shows correct /privacy-policy path
7. Verify route handles GET requests properly
8. Test route doesn't accept POST requests inappropriately

4. Check all text is readable with proper contrast
5. Verify colored cards maintain visibility in dark mode
6. Check definition cards have dark styling
7. Verify rights cards work properly in dark theme
8. Test information boxes maintain readability
9. Check all icons and elements are visible

description: Verify the Privacy Policy page is responsive across different screen sizes

2. Verify all sections display in proper layout
3. Resize browser to tablet size (768px width)
4. Check grid layouts adjust appropriately
5. Resize to mobile size (375px width)
6. Verify cards stack vertically on mobile
7. Check all text remains readable on small screens
8. Test scrolling behavior on mobile
9. Verify touch interactions work properly

description: Verify privacy policy page has proper SEO elements and metadata

4. Check for meta description tags
5. Verify proper heading hierarchy (h1, h2, h3)
6. Check structured content with semantic HTML
7. Verify Open Graph tags if present
8. Test page indexability
9. Check URL structure is SEO-friendly

description: Verify privacy policy page can be printed properly
scenario: User wants to print the privacy policy for offline reference
expected_results: Page prints with proper formatting, readable text, and page breaks
procedure:
1. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
2. Use browser print function (Ctrl+P)
3. Check print preview shows properly formatted content
4. Verify all sections are included in print version
5. Check text remains readable in print format
6. Verify background colors print appropriately
7. Test page breaks occur logically
8. Check margins and spacing in print layout
9. Verify printed version maintains content structure

description: Verify privacy policy page meets accessibility standards (WCAG)
scenario: User with disabilities accesses privacy policy using assistive technologies
expected_results: Page is fully accessible with proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support
procedure:
1. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
2. Test keyboard navigation through all content
3. Verify tab order is logical through sections
4. Check heading hierarchy is proper for screen readers
5. Test page with screen reader software
6. Verify color contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards
7. Check focus indicators are visible
8. Test with high contrast mode
9. Verify all interactive elements are accessible
10. Check ARIA landmarks are properly used

description: Verify privacy policy page loads efficiently despite substantial content
scenario: User accesses privacy policy and expects reasonable loading times
expected_results: Page loads within acceptable time limits with all content and styling
procedure:
1. Clear browser cache
2. Open browser developer tools Performance tab
3. Navigate to /privacy-policy page
4. Record page load time
5. Verify total load time is under 3 seconds
6. Check First Contentful Paint (FCP) metrics
7. Verify Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) is acceptable
8. Test page load on slower network connections
9. Check for any render-blocking resources
10. Verify content loads progressively
